attributes.action: Stop the cuts to Lancasterian sensory support service
attributes.background: I'm a mum of a child with sensory impairment and the government want to to cut the funding by £410,000. This means less support for our children and the closing of two sensory support schools. We need these services to help our children get the specialist support they require to develop. Please sign

rejection.details:
This seems to be the responsibility of Manchester City Council. 

You could raise your issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

Your local council also has a petitions process - you can find out more about it here:

http://petitions.manchester.gov.uk/petitions.ti
